physical_appearance:\The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features four women. All of them are dressed in their ethnic costumes
 which consist of piping that run down the collar to the right side. Two of the women are sitting down while the other two are standing up. The background suggests that the photograph was taken in the interior of a building. \\Chinese Women\\ is stated at the bottom. \

sgcool_label_text:This studio photograph shows four women in Chinese robes posing in an interior setting. The caption ‘Chinese women’ is inscribed at the bottom of the page.  The studio portrait on the verso shows an unidentified man in Chinese robes.The caption ‘Chinese professor’ is inscribed at the bottom of the page. These were probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.\r\n\r\nG.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert
 who was originally from Dresden
 Germany. Popular among the elites
 the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.

metadata.physical_appearance: "The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features four women. All of them are dressed in their ethnic costumes, which consist of piping that run down the collar to the right side. Two of the women are sitting down while the other two are standing up. The background suggests that the photograph was taken in the interior of a building. ""Chinese Women"" is stated at the bottom. "

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This studio photograph shows four women in Chinese robes posing in an interior setting. The caption ‘Chinese women’ is inscribed at the bottom of the page.  The studio portrait on the verso shows an unidentified man in Chinese robes.The caption ‘Chinese professor’ is inscribed at the bottom of the page. These were probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
